official-title.#text: To require that the workforce of the Environmental Protection Agency be reduced by 15 percent.

short-title.#text: EPA Maximum Achievable Contraction of Technocrats Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: finds as follows:

text.#text: During the Government shutdown of 2013, the Environmental Protection Agency deemed 95 percent of its employees as “non essential”.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: occupies space in fourteen different buildings in the District of Columbia.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: employees increased by 107 percent while the number of total Federal personnel decreased by 15 percent.

text.#text: From 1972 until 2011, the number of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: regulations cost the United States economy $353 billion.
